thread.title: Watch the Dropkick Murphys close down The Beachcomber in style - Entertainment
thread.title_full: Watch the Dropkick Murphys close down The Beachcomber in style - Entertainment

author: boston.com
title: Watch the Dropkick Murphys close down The Beachcomber in style - Entertainment
text:
Matthew J. Lee/The Boston Globe The Beachcomber in Quincy—not to be confused with the club in Wellfleet of the same name— officially closed its doors on Saturday night. It had been in business since 1959.
To go out in style, the club welcomed Boston’s own Dropkick Murphys to play the final set.
After announcing the show last week, the club sold 150 tickets online and sold another 100 at the club on the day of the show. The band’s set was a collection of originals and covers (including a relevant and obligatory “Dirty Water”).
The band kicked off the show with a moment of silence for the club, followed by a recorded introduction from club founder Jimmy McGettrick, who passed away four years ago. From there, they ripped into a version of “T.N.T.” by Aussie rockers AC/DC.
Watch it go down:
